result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S. Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the agent.

Do not have contact with minor females unless allowed by the agent.

Pay costs which will include a $500 image surcharge and the $250 DNA surcharge.  

Register as a sex offender for 15 years, beginning as soon as sentence is served.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea & Sentencing Hearing held this 22nd Day of September, 2015

Defendant Andrew S. Cook in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution, calling for def's plea to the charge in the information/complaint for 6 year sentence with 3 in and 3 out.  Court sentences per the recommendation for 6 year sentence with 3 years in and 3 years ext. supervision.  Conditions:  Attend, pay for and complete any programming ordered by agent; no contact with minor females except as allowed by agent; $500 image surcharge; regular costs including DNA surcharge; sex offender registration of 15 years to begin after sentence is served.  Felony firearm admonishment provided.  Stipulated 24 days credit.  Program eligibility.
Status conference at 09-22-2015 01:30 pm

Clerk notes that def scatched out the previous address but did not provide a replacement address.  Clerk has emailed this bond sheet back to the Richland County Sheriff's Department so that jailers can obtain def's address from him and have him place it on the bond.
Status conference at 09-09-2015 02:30 pm
Defendant to have no contact with Adriana Brown.

Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew S. Cook appeared by video means.  Today's hearing follows def's arrest on fta warrant.  ADA asks for 1k cash bond based on def's non-appearance at previous hearing.  Court orders 1k cash with the no contact condition that was part of the original bond.  Def had been represented by Atty. McDougal; needs to contact her to let her know that he's been picked up and is in the jail.  Court adjourns this case to 9/9 at 2:30 for status.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
RCSD - Disposition of Warrant or Commitment (Def in custody Grant County Jail)
Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Andrew S. Cook. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Warrant requested and authorized for def's nonappearance.
Status conference at 07-22-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Andrew S. Cook in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel request adjourn of the status; working towards resolution of this matter.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
ADA Forehand for the State. Def in person, in custody and with Atty Lisa McDougal. Parties request setover.
Defendant's...
Status conference at 04-13-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Andrew S. Cook in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M asks that formal reading be waived for completion of the initial; also states def wishes to waive his rights to a prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of prelim.  NG plea entered.  Status set for 4/13/15 at 3, same date/time as def's appearance in 15CF1.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-25-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Andrew S. Cook in custody, via video with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty M. requests adjourned initial appearance. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
9/22/15 Court orders this document sealed.
